DataElement.preferredName: Disease Screening Test And Laboratory Procedure Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates whether a patient has consented to undergo screening tests and procedures in order to determine eligibility for a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Screening Test And Laboratory Procedure Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Checking for disease when there are no symptoms. Since screening may find diseases at an early stage, there may be a better chance of curing the disease. Examples of cancer screening tests are the mammogram (breast), colonoscopy (colon), Pap smear (cervix), and PSA blood level and digital rectal exam (prostate). Screening can also include checking for a person's risk of developing an inherited disease by doing a genetic test._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Permission to do something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals.

Concepts.definition: The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals.

It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
